page.title: 02CHANGING TIMES 1945-1985
page.content: 1945 WAS THE YEAR{WORLD WAR II ENDED. MEN FROM THE FORCES STARTED COMING HOME AND EVERYONE HAD HOPES FOR A BETTER FUTURE. ONE OF THE FIRST THINGS WAS TO START BUILDING HOUSES, THAT WAS WHEN BIDEFORD STARTED TO EXPAND, &{HOUSING ESTATES}OF DETACHED SEMI_DETACHED, TERRACED HOUSES AND MAISONNETTES BEGAN TO DEVELOP. LATER FACTORIES{STARTED TO APPEAR,}eg. A.M.P., ATLAS AND LEISURE INDUSTRIES, MAINLY AT EAST-THE-WATER, WHERE THERE IS NOW A THRIVING{INDUSTRIAL ESTATE. ALTHOUGH{BIDEFORD}HAS EXPANDED GREATLY SINCE THE END OF THE WAR, ONE THING WHICH WE DID LOSE WAS THE{ {RAILWAY }WHICH CLOSED DOWN DURING THE 1960'S. TWENTY YEARS ON FROM THIS CLOSURE, WE NOW LOOK FORWARD TO THE OPENING OF THE NEW{BRIDGE}SPANNING THE {RIVER TORRIDGE.
